content: @simulacrum are you still interested in https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-central-station/issues/50#issuecomment-398582652 ?
I think Alex had some good commentary about that being a bad thing
so, the big problem I see with that is changes would be applied immediately instead of riding the trains

Purely from a sideline skim, I'd say it's a bad idea to make it harder for people to create channel manifests for custom toolchains.
If it's only moving the invocation of it then that's one thing; but we need people to be able to make channels in the future to support better custom toolchain functionality in rustup
If r-c-s is suitable for third parties to use to manage their own releases then that's fine too
oh, I plan to extract promote-release to its own repo
if we want to keep build-manifest in-tree, I think we should at least extract the signing code from it
I agree that keeping the manifest generation in rust-lang/rust is good, otherwise we need to run around updating submodules and what not
and like renaming clippy-preview to clippy would've been insta-stable
